channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Long-lived photoinduced polar states in metal halide perovskites
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 06 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-60007-w

Dou et al. report photo-induced long-lived polar states in octahedral copper-based hybrid perovskites with Jahn-Teller distortion. These states arise from reversible light-induced slow structural deformation induced by polar lattice microstrain formation.
item.dc:title: Long-lived photoinduced polar states in metal halide perovskites
item.dc:creator: Yixuan Dou

item.title: Self-sustained frictional cooling in active matter
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 06 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62626-9

Cooling in natural systems typically requires external contact with a cold reservoir, with the final temperature determined by the environment, as dictated by thermodynamics. The authors demonstrate a spontaneous, selfsustained frictional cooling effect driven by the interplay of activity, dry friction, and crowding.
item.dc:title: Self-sustained frictional cooling in active matter
item.dc:creator: Alexander P. Antonov
Marco Musacchio
Hartmut Löwen
Lorenzo Caprini
